As of mid-July, states with largest y/y increase in serious mortgage delinquency rates (90 or more days past due) were Florida, South Carolina, and Georgia ... states that saw largest declines were New York, Hawaii, and Rhode Island per ‚Å¶@cotality‚Å©  
‚Å¶@DataArbor‚Å©

Trump is going to the Federal Reserve tomorrow, according to his schedule.

Only three presidents have visited the Fed. FDR when its HQ building opened in 1938, Ford when a buddy of his became a governor, and George W. Bush for the swearing in of Ben Bernanke.

Tomorrow (Thursday), Trump is visiting the renovation of the Federal Reserve building for about an hour.

Of course, it's a publicity stunt. But it also represents a danger for Jay Powell.

Every government construction project, whether it's a municipal sewer project, building a new high school, or remodeling the Federal Reserve Building, is rife with waste, fraud, and abuse. Sadly, this is how government works.

Giving the remodeling of the Federal Reserve building an anal exam can find "For Cause" reasons to fire Powell, if this is what they genuinely want and are willing to look hard enough for it.

Trump‚Äôs AI Summit Sparks $90B+ Investments

On July 15, 2025, at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, President Donald Trump hosted the Energy and Innovation Summit where major companies like Google, Blackstone, Meta, and First Energy, among others, pledged over $90 billion in AI data centers and energy infrastructure, primarily in Pennsylvania, with Meta‚Äôs investments extending to Ohio. 

Announcements came via deals, joint ventures, and upgrades driven by Trump‚Äôs policy for rapid buildouts to meet AI power needs.

This surge seeks to secure U.S. AI leadership by pairing tech growth with reliable energy, boosting economies in battleground states amid global competition.

Source: Reuters
